meanings.definition: Assist in the birth of (a baby)
meanings.sent1: The midwife midwived the baby safely into the world.
meanings.sent2: She midwived many babies during her career as a midwife.
meanings.sent3: The midwife joked that she midwived so many babies, she could do it in her sleep!
meanings.sent4: Her gentle hands midwived new life with care and expertise.
meanings.sent5: The image of the midwife midwiving the baby was heartwarming.

meanings.definition: Give birth with the assistance of a midwife
meanings.sent1: The mother midwived her child with the help of the midwife.
meanings.sent2: Many women choose to midwife their babies in a supportive environment.
meanings.sent3: The expecting mother was relieved to have someone to midwife her through labor.
meanings.sent4: She midwived her baby into the world with gratitude for the midwife's care.
meanings.sent5: The decision to midwife her child brought a sense of empowerment to the mother.

meanings.sent1: She midwived for her sister when she went into labor unexpectedly.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, women traditionally midwife for each other.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to think it could midwife the new litter of kittens!
meanings.sent4: Her calming presence midwived a sense of peace during the birth.
meanings.sent5: The doula was asked to midwife for the first time and felt honored to assist.
